page.title: 13BROOK FARM HOUSE, L'BORO
page.content: In our D-block the oldest building appears to be what is now called Brook Farm House.The house was built in two periods and the old part is mentioned in the first Domesday Book.The new part was built around the seventeenth century.The walls are made of Charnwood granite.The ground floor is made of stone,the ceilings are made of wattle and daub,it is built on three levels.Electricity was put in during the Second World War.The present owners are not farmers.The garage used to be a cowshed.The wildlife at Brook Farm includes kingfishers & wood- peckers.A stream runs through the one acre of garden.Along the banks one can see the homes of the water voles.There are two rare flowers- the cowslip & the wild primrose.
